question_text: A binary operation \(\otimes\) is defined by \(m \otimes n = mn + m - n\) on the set of real numbers, for all m, n \(\in\) R. Find the value of 3 \(\otimes\) (2 \(\otimes\) 4).

question_text: Age in years7891011No of pupils41330449The table above shows the number of pupils in a class with respect to their ages. If a pie chart is constructed to represent the age, the angle corresponding to 8 years old is
subject: mathematics
explanation: Total number of pupils : 4 + 13 + 30 + 44 + 9 = 100 The number of 8 - year olds = 13 The angle represented by the 8-year olds on the pie chart = \(\frac{13}{100} \times 360°\) = 46.8°

question_text: In a class of 50 students, 40 students offered Physics and 30 offered Biology. How many offered both Physics and Biology?
subject: mathematics
explanation: n(Total) = 50 n(Physics) = 40 n(Biology) = 30 Let n(Physics and Biology) = x n(Physics only) = 40 -x n(Biology only) = 30 - x 40 - x + 30 - x + x = 50 70 - x = 50 x = 20

question_text: If a fair coin is tossed 3 times, what is the probability of getting at least two heads?
subject: mathematics
explanation: The outcomes are {HHH, HHT, HTT, HTH, THH, THT, TTH, TTT} P(at least two heads) = \(\frac{4}{8}\) = \(\frac{1}{2}\)

question_text: In how many ways can the word MATHEMATICIAN be arranged?
subject: mathematics
explanation: MATHEMATICIAN = 13 letters with 2M, 3A, 2T, 2I. Hence, the word MATHEMATICIAN can be arranged in \(\frac{13!}{2! 3! 2! 2!}\) = 129729600 ways

question_text: From the cyclic quadrilateral MNOP above, find the value of x.
subject: mathematics
explanation: The sum of two opposite angles of a cyclic quadrilateral = 180° \(\therefore\) (2x + 18)° + 84° = 180° 2x + 102° = 180° \(\implies\) 2x = 78° x = 39°

question_text: If \(4\sin^2 x - 3 = 0\), find the value of x, when 0° \(\leq\) x \(\leq\) 90°
subject: mathematics
explanation: \(4\sin^2 x - 3 = 0\) \(4 \sin^2 x = 3 \implies \sin^2 x = \frac{3}{4}\) \(\sin x = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\) \(\therefore x = \sin^{-1} (\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2})\) x = 60°

question_text: In the figure above, |CD| is the base of the triangle CDE. Find the area of the figure to the nearest whole number.
subject: mathematics
explanation: Area of rectangle ABCD = length x breadth = 7 x 4  = 28 cm\(^2\) Area of triangle CDE = \(\frac{1}{2}\) base x height = \(\frac{1}{2} \times 3 \times 4\) = 6 cm\(^2\) Area of the figure = 28 cm\(^2\) + 6 cm\(^2\) = 34 cm\(^2\)

question_text: The marks scored by 30 students in a Mathematics test are recorded in the table below:Scores (Mark)012345No of students437862What is the total number of marks scored by the children?
subject: mathematics

question_text: If given two points A(3, 12) and B(5, 22) on a x-y plane. Find the equation of the straight line with intercept at 2.
subject: mathematics
explanation: The equation of a straight line is given as \(y = mx + b\)  where m = the slope of the line b = intercept Given points A(3, 12) and B(5, 22), the slope = \(\frac{22 - 12}{5 - 3}\) = \(\frac{10}{2}\) = 5 Hence, the equation of the line is \(y = 5x + 2\).

question_text: If P(2, m) is the midpoint of the line joining Q(m, n) and R(n, -4), find the values of m and n.
subject: mathematics
explanation: Q(m, n) and R(n, -4) Midpoint : P(2, m) \(\implies (\frac{m + n}{2}, \frac{n - 4}{2}) = (2, m)\) \(m + n = 2 \times 2 \implies m + n = 4 ... (i)\) \(n - 4 = 2 \times m \implies n - 4 = 2m ... (ii)\) Solving (i) and (ii) simultaneously, m = 0 and n = 4.

question_text: If \(\begin{vmatrix} 2 & -4 \\ x & 9 \end{vmatrix} = 58\), find the value of x.
subject: mathematics

question_text: If \(y = 6x^3 + 2x^{-2} - x^{-3}\), find \(\frac{\mathrm d y}{\mathrm d x}\).
subject: mathematics

question_text: \(\frac{d}{dx} [\log (4x^3 - 2x)]\) is equal to
subject: mathematics
explanation: \(\frac{d}{dx} [\log (4x^3 - 2x)]\) ... (1) Let u = 4x\(^3\) - 2x. \(\frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d x} (\log (4x^3 - 2x)) = (\frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d u})(\frac{\mathrm d u}{\mathrm d x})\) \(\frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d u} (\log u)\) = \(\frac{1}{u}\) \(\frac{\mathrm d u}{\mathrm d x} = 12x^2 - 2\) \(\therefore \frac{d}{dx} [\log (4x^3 - 2x)] = \frac{12x^2 - 2}{u}\) = \(\frac{12x^2 - 2}{4x^3 - 2x}\)

question_text: Integrate \(\int_{-1} ^{2} (2x^2 + x) \mathrm {d} x\)
subject: mathematics

question_text: If P varies inversely as the square root of q, where p = 3 and q = 16, find the value of q when p = 4.
subject: mathematics
explanation: \(p \propto \frac{1}{\sqrt{q}}\) \(\implies p = \frac{k}{\sqrt{q}}\) when p = 3, q = 16. \(3 = \frac{k}{\sqrt{16}}\) \(k = 3 \times 4 = 12\) \(\therefore p = \frac{12}{\sqrt{q}}\) when p = 4, \(4 = \frac{12}{\sqrt{q}} \implies \sqrt{q} = \frac{12}{4}\) \(\sqrt{q} = 3 \implies q = 3^2 \) \(q = 9\)

question_text: Tade bought 200 mangoes at 4 for ₦2.50. 30 out of the mangoes got spoilt and the remaining were sold at 2 for ₦2.40. Find the percentage profit or loss.
subject: mathematics
explanation: 200 mangoes at 4 for N2.50 \(\implies\) Total cost price = \(\frac{200}{4} \times N 2.50\) = N 125.00 Since 30 mangoes got spoilt \(\implies\) Left over = 200 - 30 = 170 mangoes  170 mangoes at 2 for N 2.40 \(\implies\) Total selling point = \(\frac{170}{2} \times N 2.40\) = N 204.00 Profit : N (204.00 - 125.00) = N 79.00 % profit = \(\frac{79}{125} \times 100%\) = 63.2% profit.

question_text: The simple interest on ₦8550 for 3 years at x% per annum is ₦4890. Calculate the value of x to the nearest whole number.
subject: mathematics

question_text: Find the value of \(\frac{(0.5436)^3}{0.017 \times 0.219}\) to 3 significant figures.
subject: mathematics

question_text: If S = (4t + 3)(t - 2), find ds/dt when t = 5 secs.
subject: mathematics
explanation: \(s = (4t + 3)(t - 2)\) \(\frac{\mathrm d s}{\mathrm d t} = (4t + 3)(1) + (t - 2)(4)\) = \(4t + 3 + 4t - 8\) = 8t - 5 \(\frac{\mathrm d s}{\mathrm d t} (t = 5 secs) = 8(5) - 5\) = 40 - 5  = 35 units per sec

question_text: The angles of a polygon are given by 2x, 5x, x and 4x respectively. The value of x is
subject: mathematics
explanation: Since there are 4 angles given, the polygon is a quadrilateral. Sum of angle in a quadrilateral = 360° \(\therefore\) 2x + 5x + x + 4x = 360° 12x = 360° x = 30°

question_text: Points X and Y are 20km North and 9km East of point O, respectively. What is the bearing of Y from X? Correct to the nearest degree.
subject: mathematics
explanation: \(\tan \theta = \frac{9}{20} = 0.45\) \(\theta = \tan^{-1} (0.45) \) = 24.23° \(\therefore\) The bearing of Y from X = 180° - 24.23° = 155.77° = 156° (to the nearest degree)

question_text: If \(P = (\frac{Q(R - T)}{15})^{\frac{1}{3}}\), make T the subject of the formula.
subject: mathematics

question_text: In the diagram above, O is the centre of the circle ABC, < ABO = 26° and < BOC = 130°. Calculate < AOC.
subject: mathematics
explanation: < BAC = \(\frac{130}{2}\) (angle subtended at the centre) < BAC = 65° Also, x = 26° (theorem) y = 65° - 26° = 39° < AOC = 180° - (39° + 39°) = 102°

question_text: Each of the interior angles of a regular polygon is 140°. Calculate the sum of all the interior angles of the polygon.
subject: mathematics
explanation: Since each interior angle = 140°; Each exterior angle = 180° - 140° = 40° Number of sides of the polygon = \(\frac{360°}{40°}\) = 9  Sum of angles in the polygon = 140° x 9 = 1260°

question_text: A man bought a car newly for ₦1,250,000. He had a crash with the car and later sold it at the rate of ₦1,085,000. What is the percentage gain or loss of the man?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Cost price of the car = N 1,250.00 Selling price = N 1,085.00 Loss = N (1250 - 1085) = N 165.00 % loss = \(\frac{165}{1250} \times 100%\) = 13.2% loss

question_text: If the volume of a frustrum is given as \(V = \frac{\pi h}{3} (R^2 + Rr + r^2)\), find \(\frac{\mathrm d V}{\mathrm d R}\).
subject: mathematics
explanation: \(V = \frac{\pi h}{3} (R^2 + Rr + r^2)\) \(V = \frac{\pi R^2 h}{3} + \frac{\pi Rr h}{3} + \frac{\pi r^2 h}{3}\) \(\frac{\mathrm d V}{\mathrm d R} = \frac{2 \pi R h}{3} + \frac{\pi r h}{3}\) = \(\frac{\pi}{3} (2R + r)\)

question_text: Express \((0.0439 \div 3.62)\) as a fraction.
subject: mathematics

question_text: If \(25^{1 - x} \times 5^{x + 2} \div (\frac{1}{125})^{x} = 625^{-1}\), find the value of x.
subject: mathematics

question_text: A bricklayer charges ₦1,500 per day for himself and ₦500 per day for his assistant. If a two bedroom flat was built for ₦95,000 and the bricklayer worked 10 days more than his assistant, how much did the assistant receive?
subject: mathematics
explanation: Let the number of days worked by the assistant = t \(\therefore\) The bricklayer worked (t + 10) days. 1500(t + 10) + 500(t) = N 95,000 1500t + 15,000 + 500t = N 95,000 2000t = N 95,000 - N 15,000 2000t = N 80,000 t = 40 days \(\therefore\) The assistant worked for 40 days and received N (500 x 40) = N 20,000

question_text: Find the equation of the locus of a point A(x, y) which is equidistant from B(0, 2) and C(2, 1)
subject: mathematics
explanation: Since A(x, y) is the point of equidistance between B and C, then  AB = AC (AB)\(^2\) = (AC)\(^2\) Using the distance formula,  (x - 0)\(^2\) + (y - 2)\(^2\) = (x - 2)\(^2\) + (y - 1)\(^2\) x\(^2\) + y\(^2\) - 4y + 4 = x\(^2\) - 4x + 4 + y\(^2\) - 2y + 1 x\(^2\) - x\(^2\) + y\(^2\) - y\(^2\) + 4x - 4y + 2y = 5 - 4 4x - 2y = 1

question_text: A factory worker earns ₦50,000 per month out of which he spends 15% on his children's education, ₦13,600 on Food, 3% on electricity and uses the rest for his personal purpose. How much does he have left?
subject: mathematics

question_text: A binary operation Δ is defined by a Δ b = a + 3b + 2.Find (3 Δ 2) Δ 5
subject: mathematics

question_text: If M varies directly as N and inversely as the root of P. Given that M = 3, N = 5 and P = 25. Find the value of P when M = 2 and N = 6.
subject: mathematics
explanation: \(M \propto N \) ; \(M \propto \frac{1}{\sqrt{P}}\). \(\therefore M \propto \frac{N}{\sqrt{P}}\) \(M = \frac{k N}{\sqrt{P}}\) when M = 3, N = 5 and P = 25; \(3 = \frac{5k}{\sqrt{25}}\) \(k = 3\) \(M = \frac{3N}{\sqrt{P}}\) when M = 2 and N = 6, \(2 = \frac{3(6)}{\sqrt{P}} \implies \sqrt{P} = \frac{18}{2}\) \(\sqrt{P} = 9 \implies P = 9^2\) P = 81

question_text: In a committee of 5, which must be selected from 4 males and 3 females. In how many ways can the members be chosen if it were to include 2 females?
subject: mathematics
explanation: For the committee to include 2 females, we must have 3 males, so that there should be 5 members. That is, \(^4C_3 \times ^3C_2\) = \(\frac{4!}{(4 - 3)! 3!} \times \frac{3!}{(3 - 2)! 2!}\) = 4 × 3 = 12 ways

question_text: Find the polynomial if given q(x) = x\(^2\) - x - 5, d(x) = 3x - 1 and r(x) = 7.
subject: mathematics
explanation: Given q(x) [quotient], d(x) [divisor] and r(x) [remainder], the polynomial is gotten by multiplying the quotient and the divisor and adding the remainder. i.e In this case, the polynomial = (x\(^2\) - x - 5)(3x - 1) + 7. = (3x\(^3\) - x\(^2\) - 3x\(^2\) + x - 15x + 5) + 7 = (3x\(^3\) - 4x\(^2\) - 14x + 5) + 7 = 3x\(^3\) - 4x\(^2\) - 14x + 12

question_text: If 2x\(^2\) + x - 3 divides x - 2, find the remainder.
subject: mathematics
explanation: When you divide a polynomial p(x) by (x - a), the remainder = p(a) i.e. In the case of 2x\(^2\) + x - 3 \(\div\) (x - 2), the remainder = p(2). = 2(2)\(^2\) + 2 - 3 = 8 + 2 - 3 = 7.

question_text: If \(\left|\begin{array}{lll} 2 & -5 & 3 \\ x & 1 & 4 \\ 0 & 3 & 2 \end{array}\right| = 132\), find the value of x.

question_text: If y = 8x\(^3\) - 3x\(^2\) + 7x - 1, find \(\frac{\mathrm d^2 y}{\mathrm d x^2}\).
subject: mathematics
explanation: y = 8x\(^3\) - 3x\(^2\) + 7x - 1 \(\frac{\mathrm d^2 y}{\mathrm d x^2}  = \frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d x} (\frac{\mathrm d y}{\mathrm d x})\) = \(\frac{\mathrm d}{\mathrm d x} (24x^2 - 6x + 7)\) \(\frac{\mathrm d^2 y}{\mathrm d x^2} = 48x - 6\)

question_text: Find the equation of a line perpendicular to the line 4y = 7x + 3 which passes through (-3, 1)
subject: mathematics
explanation: Equation: 4y = 7x + 3 \(\implies y = \frac{7}{4} x + \frac{3}{4}\) Slope = coefficient of x = \(\frac{7}{4}\) Slope of perpendicular line = \(\frac{-1}{\frac{7}{4}}\) = \(\frac{-4}{7}\) The perpendicular line passes (-3, 1) \(\therefore\) Using the equation of line \(y = mx + b\) m = slope and b = intercept. \(y = \frac{-4}{7} x + b\) To find the intercept, substitute y = 1 and x = -3 in the equation. \(1 = \frac{-4}{7} (-3) + b\) \(1 = \frac{12}{7} + b\) \(b = \frac{-5}{7}\) \(\therefore y = \frac{-4}{7} x - \frac{5}{7}\) \(7y + 4x + 5 = 0\)

question_text: Calculate the volume of the regular three-dimensional figure drawn above, where
subject: mathematics
explanation: |AC| = |DF| = 13 cm Using Pythagoras theorem, |AC|\(^2\) = |AB|\(^2\) + |BC|\(^2\) 13\(^2\) = 12\(^2\) + |BC|\(^2\) |BC|\(^2\) = 169 - 144 = 25 |BC| = \(\sqrt{25}\) = 5 cm Volume of triangular prism = \(\frac{1}{2} \times base \times length \times height\) = \(\frac{1}{2} \times 5 \times 12 \times 18\) = 540 cm\(^3\)
